Properties to be used in skin files.

= Introduction =

In order to facilitate skin file modding, a number of property fields have been created so that these can in turn be used in xml files.


= Details =

  * *#MovingPictures.DVDArt*
 This property holds the folder under which full size DVDArt images are stored.  By default, this resolves to *_thumbspath_\MovingPictures\DVDArt\FullSize*

 In a skin file, this can be used as follows:
 {{{
<!-- m3rcury : Rotating DVDArt -->
    <control>
      <description>Rotating Movie disc</description>
      <type>image</type>
      <id>0</id>
      <posX>65</posX>
      <posY>300</posY>
      <width>386</width>
      <height>350</height>
      <texture>#MovingPictures.DVDArt\#MovingPictures.SelectedMovie.imdb_id.png</texture>
      <keepaspectratio>yes</keepaspectratio>
      <visible>facadeview.list+control.isvisible(50)+Control.HasThumb(90)</visible>
      <animation effect="rotate" delay="0" end="-360" centre="475,258" time="8000" loop="true" condition="true">Conditional</animation>
    </control>
<!-- m3rcury : Rotating DVDArt -->
}}}

  * *#MovingPictures.ClearArt*
 This property holds the folder under which full size ClearArt images are stored.  By default, this resolves to *_thumbspath_\MovingPictures\ClearArt\FullSize*

 In a skin file, this can be used as follows:
 {{{
<!-- m3rcury - ClearArt -->
    <control>
      <description>Movie ClearArt</description>
      <type>image</type>
      <id>0</id>
      <posX>1000</posX>
      <posY>420</posY>
      <width>250</width>
      <height>126</height>
      <keepaspectratio>yes</keepaspectratio>
      <texture>#MovingPictures.ClearArt\#MovingPictures.SelectedMovie.imdb_id.png</texture>
      <visible>string.contains(#Play.Current.Thumb,MovingPictures)</visible>
    </control>
<!-- m3rcury - ClearArt -->
}}}

  * *#MovingPictures.ClearLogo*
 This property holds the folder under which full size ClearLogo images are stored.  By default, this resolves to *_thumbspath_\MovingPictures\ClearLogo\FullSize*

 In a skin file, this can be used as follows:
 {{{
<!-- m3rcury - ClearLogo -->
    <control>
      <description>Clear Logo</description>        
      <type>image</type>
      <id>0</id>
      <posX>1000</posX>
      <posY>300</posY>
      <width>194</width>
        <height>75</height>
      <keepaspectratio>yes</keepaspectratio>
      <texture>#MovingPictures.ClearLogo\#MovingPictures.SelectedMovie.imdb_id.png</texture>
      <visible>!control.isvisible(50)+!control.isvisible(51)+!control.hasfocus(667)</visible>
      <animation effect="fade" time="250" delay="0">VisibleChange</animation>
    </control>
<!-- m3rcury - ClearLogo -->
}}}

  * *#Person.Thumb*
 This property holds the folder under which Actors, Writers and Directors photos are stored.  By default, this resolves to *_thumbspath_\Actors*

 In a skin file, this can be used as follows:
 {{{
<!-- m3rcury -->
    <!-- Selected Category Actors/Directors/Writers Facade Item --> 
    <control>
       <description>Default Actors-Directors-Writers Image</description>
       <type>image</type>
       <id>201</id>
       <posX>225</posX>
       <posY>495</posY>
       <width>511</width>
       <height>511</height>
       <texture>#Person.Thumb\Actor.png</texture>
       <keepaspectratio>yes</keepaspectratio>
       <animation effect="fade" time="250">WindowOpen</animation>
       <animation effect="fade" time="250">WindowClose</animation>
       <visible>control.isvisible(51)+!Control.HasThumb(100)+!Control.HasThumb(200)</visible>
     </control>
     <control>
       <description>Actors Image</description>
       <type>image</type>
       <id>200</id>
       <posX>225</posX>
       <posY>495</posY>
       <width>511</width>
       <height>511</height>
       <texture>#Person.Thumb\#MovingPictures.SelectedNode.FileFriendlyName.png</texture>
       <keepaspectratio>yes</keepaspectratio>
       <animation effect="fade" time="250">WindowOpen</animation>
       <animation effect="fade" time="250">WindowClose</animation>
       <visible>control.isvisible(51)</visible>
    </control>
<!-- m3rcury -->
}}}

  * *#TVSeries.ClearArt*
 This property holds the folder under which full size ClearArt images are stored.  By default, this resolves to *_thumbspath_\TVSeries\ClearArt\FullSize*

 In a skin file, this can be used as follows:
 {{{
<!-- m3rcury - ClearArt -->
    <control>
      <description>ClearArt</description>
      <type>image</type>
      <id>0</id>
      <posX>1100</posX>
      <posY>90</posY>
      <texture>#TVSeries.ClearArt\#(string.rtrim(#TVSeries.Series.ID)).png</texture>
      <visible>[[control.isvisible(1237)|control.isvisible(1238)]+control.isvisible(1242)]+facadeview.list</visible>
      <animation effect="fade" time="250" delay="0">WindowClose</animation>
    </control>
<!-- m3rcury - ClearArt -->
}}}

  * *#TVSeries.ClearLogo*
 This property holds the folder under which full size ClearLogo images are stored.  By default, this resolves to *_thumbspath_\TVSeries\ClearLogo\FullSize*

 In a skin file, this can be used as follows:
 {{{
<!-- m3rcury - ClearLogo -->
    <control>
      <description>ClearLogo</description>
      <type>image</type>
      <id>0</id>
      <posX>10</posX>
      <posY>450</posY>
      <texture>#TVSeries.ClearLogo\#(string.rtrim(#TVSeries.Series.ID)).png</texture>
      <visible>control.isvisible(1239)+facadeview.list</visible>
      <animation effect="fade" time="250" delay="0">WindowClose</animation>
    </control>
<!-- m3rcury - ClearLogo -->
}}}

 To display TVSeries ClearLogo in VideoOSD, change the TVSeries.SkinSettings.xml as follows:
 {{{
  <!-- Define the images loaded in properties during play -->
  <videoplayimages import="true">
    <property>
      <name>TVSeries.Play.ClearArt</name>
      <value><![CDATA[thumbs\TVSeries\ClearArt\FullSize\<Series.ID>.png]]></value>
    </property>
    <!-- You can define multiple properties -->
  </videoplayimages>
}}}

  * *#Music.Banner*

  * *#Music.ClearLogo*
 This property holds the folder under which full size Artist Clear Logo images are stored.  By default, this resolves to *_thumbspath_\Music\ClearLogo\FullSize*
